sense.name: a metal which is an iron alloy, commonly used in construction
sense.examples: The steel used in the Titanic was somewhat more brittle than modern steel. The I-beams on that skyscraper are all made of steel. We enjoyed listening to the steel band. Bob has a steel plate in his head. Use some steel wool to clean that screen.

sense.name: a sword or blade
sense.examples: The duelists flashed their steels at each other. The knight drove his steel into the heart of his enemy.

sense.name: a metal rod used to sharpen knives
sense.examples: I found a steel in a drawer to sharpen the kitchen knives with. The steel hangs on a hook next to the copper pots.

sense.name: the manufacturing industry that produces steel
sense.examples: Some cities never recovered economically after their steel mills went overseas. The auto makers are at odds with big steel over the rising costs. The steel industry supports the regulatory trade measures.

sense.name: shares of stock in a steel company
sense.examples: He has a third of his stock in steel. My broker's advice was to sell steel and buy gold. Shares of United Steel were up 15 and a quarter today.

sense.name: a quality of strength or hardness
sense.examples: Sally has nerves of steel. He exhibited a will of steel when it came to his training for the marathon.
